content:
Hello fellow rustaceans. I'm looking for some effective yet comprehensive (yet not too much to dig through) overviews of unicode/utf8/ascii/ansi/strings/characters/etc. You already know why..

If you have any favorite hidden gems (youtube videos/articles/etc) that you've bookmarked due to quality please feel free to share on this thread! :crab:

Obligatory: https://utf8everywhere.org/

And my favourite strings-in-rust article (disguised as fizz-buzz): https://chrismorgan.info/blog/rust-fizzbuzz/

This URLO had some good content: https://users.rust-lang.org/t/why-is-a-char-valid-in-jvm-but-invalid-in-rust/73524/5?u=scottmcm

@scottmcm wonderful, thank you.

Related, if anyone has any hidden gems related to Internationalization & Rust I'd appreciate those as well
https://www.viewpoints-and-perspectives.info/home/perspectives/internationalization/

A few from google:

  • https://www.arewewebyet.org/topics/i18n/ (Seems i18n for Rust is WIP)
  • https://blog.logrocket.com/rust-internationalization-localization-and-translation/ (Walks thru each of the projects listed in above link, plus a couple more)
